discussion.content:
SIP Route pattern does not accept @-symbol.
Thus answer D is correct

Selected Answer: D
In SIP route pattern there two pattern usage: "Domain Routing" and "IPAddress Routing". So they do not accept @ character. SIP route patterns matching on the host part of the directory URI can match on a domain name or an IP address, both of which can be configured after the @ on directory URIs. Wildcards can be used in the IPv4 patterns to match on multiple domains, such as *.cisco.com and ccm[1-4].uc.cisco.com. In IP address SIP route patterns, a subnet notation can be used, such as 192.168.10.0/24. To create a SIP route pattern that matches any domain, you can just put * (star) in the pattern string field.
CCNP and CCIE Collaboration Core CLCOR 350-801 Official Cert Guide
Chapter 19: Configuring Globalized Call Routing in Cisco Unified Communications Manager

Selected Answer: D
For Domain Routing pattern usage, enter a domain name IPv4 Pattern field that can resolve to an IPv4 address. The domain name can contain the following characters: [, -, ., 0-9, A-Z, a-z, *, and ].

Selected Answer: D
It's D. Just tried to create a SIP route pattern including the @ character and got an error message telling me which characters are allowed.

Selected Answer: D
@not allowed
why not A?

Selected Answer: D
Definitely D. "(", ")" and "@" are not allowed

Selected Answer: D
I would go with D as well

Selected Answer: D
Valid characters for domain names are [, -, ., 0-9, A-Z, a-z, *, and ] Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
You're right pan_tarej : SIP Route pattern does not accept @-symbol.

"Domain name examples are cisco.com, my-pc.cisco.com, *.com, rtp-ccm[1-5].cisco.com. Valid characters
for domain names are [, -, ., 0-9, A-Z, a-z, *, and ]."

besides using @-symbol in routepattern would allocate NANP dialplan

SIP route pattern need wildcard , which is Answer A

questions.question_text: An administrator must make a pattern to route calls to two different destinations: john.doe@company.com and jane.doe@company.com. Which type of patterns are needed in the Cisco UCM, and what must the pattern look like?

choices.D: A SIP route pattern that looks like this: company.com
choices.B: A regular route pattern with the URI feature enabled in the configuration page. The pattern must look like this: MATCH(*.doe@company.com)
choices.A: A SIP route pattern that looks like this: *@company.com
choices.C: A regular route pattern with the URI feature enabled in the configuration page. The pattern must look like this: (*@company.com)

discussion.content: SNMP Master Agent serves as the primary service for the MIB interface. You must manually activate Cisco CallManager SNMP service; all other SNMP services should be running after installation.

Selected Answer: B
Cisco CallManager SNMP bellongs to feature services who needs to be enabled manually.

comments.content: Host Resources Agent and SNMP Master Agent are network services

discussion.content: B is correct here.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The 4/5 class model is the simplest of the three models in terms of QoS polices and typically accounts for real-time communications, call signaling, critical data, best-effort data, and scavenger data. The call signaling and critical data are often grouped together as a “mission-critical” category, thus this model is called the 4/5 class model.
CCNP and CCIE Collaboration Core CLCOR 350-801 Official Cert Guide
Chapter 13: Layer 2 and Layer 3 QoS Parameters.

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B look at the information on Kevin Wallace Course QoS recommendation module.

questions.question_text: A high-speed network is often configured with a five-class QoS model. Which classes are used in the model?

choices.C: real-time, signaling, critical data, best-effort, and drop-class
choices.A: voice, video, signaling critical data, and best-effort
choices.B: real-time, call-signaling, critical data, best-effort, and scavenger
choices.D: call-signaling, real-time, critical data, best-effort, and drop-class

questions.question_text: Which value should be changed when each Cisco UCM node does not allow for more than 5000 phones to be registered?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Checked in my LAB environment and A is correct

choices.B: Maximum Number of Registered and Unregistered Devices service parameter on each node
choices.D: Maximum Number of Phones service parameter on the Publisher
choices.C: Minimum Number of Phones service parameter on each node
choices.A: Maximum Number of Registered Devices service parameter on each node

questions.question_text: Which QoS marking is used when an administrator configures voice call signaling?

discussion.content:
Voice Only 5 EF 46 5
Voice/Video 4 AF41 34 4
Telepresence Video 4 CS4 32 4
Streaming Video 3 CS4 32 3
Call Signaling 3 CS3 24 3

Selected Answer: B
Call-Signaling traffic should be marked as DSCP CS3 per the QoS Baseline (during migration, it also can be marked the legacy value of DSCP AF31).

https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=357102
It's B, Voice signaling. EF is RTP traffic

Selected Answer: A
It's A - voice traffic is EF
